prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Memorabilia, 1917-1919, in the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection Accession 10875-m, 10875-n, 10875-o, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the Library by Matthew Bruccoli, Columbia, South Carolina, on May 7, 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Bruccoli Great War Collection consists of three items, 1917-1919, including one medal, one inch in diameter, inscribed with "LEST WE FORGET APR. 6, 1917 - NOV. 11, 1918" and on the verso, "THE PRICE 268,204 CASUALITIES"; and two lapel pins both produced by the Whitemead & Hoag Company, Newark, New Jersey, one with a white background and the inscription, "W.S.S. PLEDGED FOR 1918," and the other with a flag shield and money chest emblem and inscribed, "YORK WAR CHEST I HAVE CONTRIBUTED, HAVE YOU?"
